item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Was December’s Best-Selling Video Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-was-decembers-best-selling-video-game/

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 closed 2024 as the best-selling game for December in the United States, keeping it’s hold on the top spot for the second-straight month.

The news comes via the latest sales data from Circana on January 23.

Following Black Ops 6 on the list were Madden NFL 25, College Football 25, EA Sports FC 25, and Super Mario Party Jamboree at two through five, respectively. As far as the rest of the top 20 goes, six games either made their debut or returned to the chart. The big new debut was Indiana Jones and the Great Circle at 14. Other games new or returning to this month’s top 20 were Elden Ring, Helldivers 2, Mario Kart 8, God of War: Ragnarok, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, and Just Dance 2025.

You can check out the full list of the best-selling games for December 2024 below. In addition to December’s best-selling games, the top games of 2024 were also announced.

Top 20 Best-Selling Games For December 2024

  1. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  2. Madden NFL 25
  3. EA Sports College Football 25
  4. EA Sports FC 25
  5. Super Mario Party Jamboree
  6. Sonic X Shadow Generations
  7. Hogwarts Legacy
  8. Astro Bot
  9. Minecraft
  10. NBA 2K25
  11. Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero
  12. Elden Ring
  13. Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
  14. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  15. Helldivers 2
  16. Mario Kart 8
  17. Mario & Luigi: Brothership
  18. God of War: Ragnarok
  19. The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom
  20. Just Dance 2025 Edition

What do you think about the best-selling games for December 2024 and Black Ops 6 staying on top? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Space-Time Smackdown Set A2—Release Date, New Booster Packs & Trading Added
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-space-time-smackdown-release-date/

Weeks of speculation and rumors have come to a head as we finally have confirmation of A2. Pokémon TCG Pocket’s new A2 Set is here—named Space-Time Smackdown—and we know its start date, which new cards are included, and much more.

The A2 Set talk has come true, as expected. Pokémon TCG Pocket is introducing a new set to kick off 2025—Space-Time Smackdown. The funky-sounding name is apt (more on this later) and is a big step up compared to the mini-set-nature of Mythical Island.

Genetic Apex has kept the app stocked with cards for a while, but it’s time for Space-Time Smackdown to shake up the meta and daily routine of opening Packs.

Pokémon TCG Pocket Space-Time Smackdown Release Date

Space-Time Smackdown first debuts in Pokémon TCG Pocket on Wednesday, January 29, followed by a global launch on Thursday, January 30.

It’s likely a same-time rollout for Space-Time Smackdown. The key difference is New Zealand players get to experience the joy of the new set first because of the time difference—hence January 29. This is the way for virtually every game release, and Pocket is the same here.

Every New Space-Time Smackdown Card in Pokémon TCG Pocket

So far, we know of a few Pokémon TCG Pocket Space-Time Smackdown Cards including Dialga ex, Palkia ex, a Lucario Full Art, Turtwig, Chimchar, and Piplup.

It’s confirmed the set has “Over 140 cards including exciting Pokémon ex cards, new Trainer cards, and gorgeous immersive cards ready to bring you into the wondrous world of Pokémon.”

Here’s a full list of every card revealed so far in the new Space-Time Smackdown set:

  • Chimchar
  • Cresselia
  • Gible
  • Honchkrow
  • Leafeon
  • Piplup
  • Turtwig
  • Dialga ex
  • Pachirisu ex
  • Palkia ex
  • Cynthia (Full Art)
  • Lucario (Full Art)

The debut trailer only gave away a small mackerel of cards. Another trailer close to launch—or a comprehensive leak—could tell us more. For now, we’ll take these cards, and you can see them for yourself in The Official Pokémon YouTube channel‘s Space-Time Smackdown debut trailer!

Which Generation is Pokémon TCG Pocket Space-Time Smackdown Set?

The 4th Generation of Pokémon is the focus of Pocket’s Space-Time Smackdown A2 Set.

Everyone—myself included—thought the second set would naturally follow the chronology of Pokémon. Genetic Apex was predominantly a Kanto set. It makes sense A2 would move on to Johto for the second set, but alas, this is not the case.

I’m pleasantly surprised as it means to expect the unexpected.

The development teams are going to mix things up and keep us on our toes. It also means we probably get some amazing Mon in Space-Time Smackdown: Infernape, Bidoof, Kricketot, Kricketune, Mismagius, Munchlax, Glaceon, and many more.

Trading Added Ahead of Space-Time Smackdown

Trading arrives on January 28—the day before Space-Time Smackdown gets underway.

It’ll already be in the game before the A2 Set Booster Packs launch; however, we’re glad to finally see Trading. Adding it the day before gives the team a chance to ensure it’s implemented properly before Space-Time Smackdown is live. You can also spend the last few hours swapping cards with friends to fill out decks before you have a new set to start over with.

I’m always giddy before a new event gets underway. I’ve got Hourglasses galore and all the resources ready to complete the Space-Time Smackdown set. Are you looking forward to it? Are you surprised to see Gen 4 as A2’s main focus?

Check out the news of Pokémon Center London’s pop-up store, McDonald’s’ special Pokémon promo cards, and the latest Pokémon Legends Z-A details while you wait for Space-Time Smackdown.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Developers Have Already Written Part 3’s Story
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/final-fantasy-7-remake-developers-have-already-written-part-3s-story/

The developers of Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 have confirmed that the game’s story was completed at the end of 2024.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 Story Has Been Completed

As spotted by Genki_JPN on X (via The Gamer), Final Fantasy 7 Remake producer Yoshinori Kitase and director Naoki Hamaguchi discussed Part 3’s plot during an interview with Famitsu. Kitase stated that Tetsuya Nomura, Final Fantasy 7 Remake director, handed over the story for part 3 at the end of last year, and he is “very satisfied with it” and is “sure it will be a satisfying conclusion for fans as well”.

Kitase elaborates that Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 is the conclusion of the series, making it integral into the franchise. Hence, he gave Nomura the homework to deliver “something that would respect the original while also giving a sense of satisfaction beyond what could be experienced in the original.” He wants a story that can “conclude the Remake Project.” It seems we might receive this instalment much sooner than expected. 

FF7 Rebirth’s PC Upgrades Might Arrive for PS5 Version

The developers also discussed bringing FF7 Rebirth PC’s upgrades to the PS5 version. Naoki Hamaguchi revealed they received many requests for upgrades for the PC version to be brought to the PS5 version. The developers “would like to make it happen at some point,” but it has to be within the PS5 version’s performance limits.
